org.noip.evan1026.graphics

Class Rope

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.noip.evan1026.graphics.Rope

  • public class Rope
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rope(Projectile proj1, Projectile proj2)
      Initializes the rope, which is simply defined by the two Projectiles that it's attached to.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw()
      Does some magic OpenGL stuff to draw the rope to the screen.

      boolean isSolidified()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rope

        public Rope(Projectile proj1,
    Projectile proj2)
        Initializes the rope, which is simply defined by the two Projectiles that it's attached to.
        Parameters:
        proj1 - The first Projectile the rope is attached to.
        proj2 - The second Projectile the rope is attached to.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Does some magic OpenGL stuff to draw the rope to the screen.

      • getAttachedProjectiles

        public Projectile[] getAttachedProjectiles()
        Returns:
        The two Projectiles that define the rope.

      • lostProjectile

        public boolean lostProjectile()
        Returns:
        True if either Projectile is out of bounds or has been marked to be destroyed.

      • setSolidified

        public void setSolidified(boolean solidified)
        Parameters:
        solidified - Whether or not the rope is "solidified." It is considered solidified when it is connecting two Projectiles that are both on valid spheres to be connected.

      • isSolidified

        public boolean isSolidified()
        Returns:
        Whether or not the rope is "solidified." See setSolidified for a further explaination.
